intro: Hengduanshania, commonly known as the Hengduan Mountains rhododendron, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Hengduan Mountains region of western China, where it thrives in high-altitude, humid environments. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that come in a range of colors, including red, pink, and white. Hengduanshania species are typically evergreen shrubs with leathery, elliptical leaves. These plants play an important role in the biodiversity of their mountainous habitats and are of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
